title: Maxwell Acquires Daily Mirror for £113 Million, Expanding Media Empire
summary: Robert Maxwell acquires Mirror Group Newspapers (MGN) from Reed International for £113 million, gaining control of six British newspapers including the Daily Mirror, traditionally a pro-Labour tabloid. This acquisition significantly expands Maxwell's media influence in Britain and triggers a media war with Rupert Murdoch. The Daily Mirror acquisition provides Maxwell with a major platform for information warfare and intelligence influence operations, while his continued Eastern Bloc connections raise questions about foreign intelligence penetration of British media infrastructure.
